title: Replace homepage background with user photo and apply dark overlay with fixed positioning

requirements.text: Remove the existing old-man picture (1770720033234.jpg) from the Home page hero section entirely

quotes: Remove the old old-man picture completely

acceptanceCriteria: The circular user photo previously displayed below the 'MHS★Online Earn Platform' title is removed from the DOM
No references to 1770720033234.jpg remain in the Home page component

requirements.text: Set the uploaded user photo (1770720033234-1.jpg) as the background image for the Hero Section on the Home page

quotes: Set my uploaded photo as the background for the Hero Section or the entire landing page

acceptanceCriteria: The uploaded photo 1770720033234-1.jpg is rendered as a background image covering the hero section
Background image uses CSS background-size: cover and background-position: center for proper display
The hero section maintains its existing layout with all text and buttons visible

requirements.text: Apply a dark transparent overlay (rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5) or similar) on top of the background image to ensure white text remains clearly readable

quotes: Use a dark overlay (transparent black layer) over the image so that the white text ('MHS★Online Earn Platform') remains clearly readable

acceptanceCriteria: A semi-transparent black overlay is applied between the background image and the hero section content
The 'MHS★Online Earn Platform' title text and all other white text elements have sufficient contrast for readability
The overlay does not obscure the background image completely but provides clear text legibility

requirements.text: Configure the background image with CSS background-attachment: fixed so it stays in place when scrolling the page

quotes: Make the image 'Fixed' so it stays in place when scrolling

acceptanceCriteria: The background image uses background-attachment: fixed CSS property
When scrolling the page, the background image remains stationary while content scrolls over it
The fixed background effect works on desktop and tablet viewports (may fall back to scroll on mobile for performance)

constraints: Do not modify the existing Header component or navigation structure
Preserve all existing hero section content including title text, user count, status text, and CTA buttons
Do not change the backend or any data models
nonGoals: Modifying the circular profile photo styling (that photo is being removed entirely)
Changing the color theme or existing blue/white styling beyond the background overlay
Adding new hero section content or features
